xmltools

Class XMLParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • xmltools.XMLParser

  • public class XMLParser
extends java.lang.Object
    Class description: This class is a parser for XML files. It will parse the file, check for errors, and print out the errors. First it use a stack to get the tags and check if they are right. Then it use a queue to store the xml lines and a stack to store the xml tags. It will check if the tags are matched and if the tags are in the right order. If there is an error, it will store the error in a queue. Then, it will check tags stack to see if there is any tag left in the stack. If there is, it will store the error in the queue. After that, it will check queues and print out the errors.

    • Constructor Detail

      • XMLParser

        public XMLParser(java.lang.String xmlFilePath)
        This is the constructor of the XMLParser class. It will initialize the queues and stacks. Then it will call the parse method to parse the XML file. pre-condition: The XML file must be existed and in the right format. post-condition: The XML file will be parsed. If there is any error, it will be stored in the error queue.
        Parameters:
        xmlFilePath - The path of the XML file.

    • Method Detail

      • initialXMLLines

        private void initialXMLLines()
        This method is used to get the XML lines from the XML file. pre-condition: The XML file must be existed and in the right format. post-condition: The XML lines will be stored in the xmlLines queue.

      • parserTags

        private void parserTags()
        This method is used to parse the XML file. pre-condition: The XML lines are stored in the XMLLines queue. post-condition: The XML file will be parsed. If there is any error, it will be stored in the error queue.

      • checkParser

        private void checkParser(XMLTag tag)
        This method is used to check if the tag is correct. pre-condition: The XML file must be existed and in the right format. post-condition: The XML file will be parsed. If there is any error, it will be stored in the error queue.
        Parameters:
        tag - The XML tag.

        private void checkError()
